snippet: Senator Dianne Feinstein, the chairwoman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said the C.I.A. searched computers being used by committee staff members to investigate the agency’s interrogation tactics.
abstract: Festering conflict between the Central Intelligence Agency and its congressional overseers breaks into the open when Sen Dianne Feinstein, chairwoman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, delivers extraordinary denunciation of the agency; Feinstein accuses CIA of withholding information about its treatment of prisoners and trying to intimidate Intelligence Committee staff members investigating its detention program.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt and Charlie Savage contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Senator Dianne Feinstein, the chairwoman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said the C.I.A. searched computers being used by committee staff members to investigate the agency’s interrogation tactics.

headline.main: Conflict Erupts in Public Rebuke on C.I.A. Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Conflict Erupts in Public Rebuke on C.I.A. Inquiry
